UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that represents a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Redesigning Arenicin-1, an Antimicrobial Peptide from the Marine Polychaeta Arenicola marina, by Strand Rearrangement or Branching, Substitution of Specific Residues, and Backbone Linearization or Cyclization.
Literature.Author: Orlov DS, Shamova OV, Eliseev IE, Zharkova MS, Chakchir OB, Antcheva N, Zachariev S, Panteleev PV, Kokryakov VN, Ovchinnikova TV, Tossi A

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: Human erythrocytes:15% Hemolysis=14 µM,Human erythrocytes:50% Hemolysis=65.5 µM
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Escherichia coli ML-35p(MIC=1-2µM),Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=2µM),Escherichia coli M15(MIC=2µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=1µM),Listeria monocytogenes EGD(MIC=2µM),Staphylococcus aureus 710A(MIC=2µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=2µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 33591(MIC=4µM),Staphylococcus aureus(MIC=4µM),Staphylococcus intermedius(MIC=4µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa(MIC=2µM),Acinetobacter baumannii(MIC=4µM),Human myelogenous leukemia K562(IC50=16.2µM)
